intro: Medinilla matthewii, commonly known as the velvet tangerine. This flowering plant is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its glossy, waxy leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its unique appearance and pleasant fragrance make it a popular choice for indoor and tropical gardens.
